data.title: Soup and sandwiches of course.
data.text: You can mix and match so many different healthy sandwiches and food. This is a really nice mix and gives you a multitude of choices.

data.title: wholesome food food
data.text: excellent service plenty of seating fresh healthy food with excellent choices....especially the soup and salad....very reasonably priced..highly recommend this for a quick wholesome lunch

data.title: Tasty American fare
data.text: A clean, fresh chain location that offers classics like grilled cheese sandwiches and Chicken Ceasar salad. This is a good chain franchise and a good operator.

data.title: The Pits
data.text: This place was great when it first opened. It's gone downhill ever since. I actually saw an employee fight with a customer who was a little kid. People walked out. The staff here is unfriendly. I went one day and they had no salad. Not worth going here anymore.

data.title: Not Impressed
data.text: I was at Panera Bread restaurant with friends but I was never impressed by this place. I did not  like the food at all.

data.title: Inconsistent
data.text: loved Panera ever since they opened here but in the last 2 years something has changed at this location.  Service has slowed and orders are not always right.  One day I showed up to pick up to go order 20 minutes after placing the order and still had to wait 20 min for my food as others in line were complaining they had been waiting 30 min.  Another time I ordered a salad and it was completely wrong - they got halfway thru making the correct salad then put a bunch of ingredients from a different salad in and the wrong dressing.  I ended up throwing it away.  Ordered a broth bowl to go and there was barely any broth - quarter cup at most.  I still will eat here but now I always check my food before leaving.

data.title: Good food, slightly over priced
data.text: Always dependable food, nice selection but the prices ae a bit high for this type of chain coffee restaurant.

data.title: Simple American Food, Convenient location
data.text: Panera is great because their food is very simple and always consistent quality wherever you go.  The Panera in White Plains is conveniently located in the city center and has ample seating.

data.title: Sandwiches, Soups or Salads
data.text: This place never disappoints and there is something for everyone. I'm not much for chain restaurants but this place is definitely OFF the chain. 👌🏼

data.title: Skip this location
data.text: I was there for lunch and was in a hurry.  I paid with a gift certificate and they did not know what to do; they asked a manager and they had to get another manager who was too busy on their cell phone to pay attention.  Then my cashier Shanise had to go make my sandwich herself because the staff was too busy arguing over nonsense.  I ordered a large soda and they were out of cups.... this was not a good experience at this location... skip there are plenty of others.

data.title: Good food
data.text: The soup is really good. The restaurant is nothing special.  The staff is not particularly helpful.  But, the soup is really good!

data.title: Disappointing visit
data.text: I'm a huge fan of Panera Bread but this particular one was very disappointing.  I visited Saturday morning while the restaurant was not busy.  There appeared to be plenty of workers so that was not an issue.  My order was totally messed up - instead of a half Greek salad, I got a half Greens salad and my half turkey avocado BLT with no mayo ended up being a half turkey avocado with mayo and no bacon.  Also missing was my baguette.  The order took a very long time to fill.  The website says if there are mistakes to bring it back but as it already took way too long, I just ate what I got and vowed to never return.  Too bad, White Plains.

data.title: Service is very poor
data.text:
I love panera and have used their catering services in other areas in CT but will not go to this one white plains ever again. I called to talk about having 4 separate company breakfasts catered with 60 ppl each. Pretty costly but for the quality panera usually provides it is worth - especially considering they deliver when catered. My first message was never returned and knowing that these events were only coupe of weeks away I called again the second day. This time the lady that answered said she could help me with catering instead of passing along a message which is what happened first time. She was friendly , courteous but didn't seem too knowledgable. I did all the work in advance by putting together my own menu from their website catering selections. My order would have been 6/7 hundred dollars for each breakfast. That's a couple grand in total for 4 breakfast events. She said she needed to ask her catering manager questions before she could confirm my order and we agreed to speak the next day. She never did call me back and that was 7 days ago! So I called a third time and was asked to hold to talk to some one about catering. See the photo I added it plainly shows I was on hold with their number for over 5 minutes and no one came on during that time to check on my or offer to take a message. 

Panera - you could be in high demand in this area . Great brand and reputation but if your short staffed and / or have team members that don't really care then you better step it up. I'm sure my order won't break you but you missed an opportunity to cater events for a business leader in you market where attendees would have been your customers in future too. Will not get my money that's for sure. Very disappointing!

data.title: Service is a little bit of a miss
data.text: I have been to a lot of Panera's in the NYC area and was glad to finally see one arrive in White Plains.  It's pretty clear they have some hiring issues and process issues at this location.  Food is slow to be served, the employees seam slow and there was a Hiring sign in the window so that is also probably a good indication.  I will assume that at some point they will get it together but right now it's a miss.  The other issue I disliked about this location is that parking is a big issue and it's difficult to get to.

data.title: Love the Location & How about those Orange Scones!!!
data.text: Love my Panera but never been to the White Plains location. Right across from hotel I absolutely loved this. Great location, Great menu, Great soup & never a let down with those orange scones! I was greeted immediately and even though the gentleman who took our order wasn't the cheerleader type he was good, got our order correct ( which doesn't always happen) woman preparing it was very personable & friendly as the gentleman who made our sandwich. Maria is a really nice manager as I returned to this location several times during my stay. I give this a thumbs up and a must stop!

data.title: Free Pastry
data.text: I was in the mood for soup and a sandwich and the best place for that combination is Panera Bread.  I ordered my food and gave my the cashier my phone number for my rewards points and since my birthday is in January, I was awarded a free pastry, I got the carrot cake, YUMMY !!!!!!

data.title: Average
data.text: Good coffee -- but the menu is not that healthy in general. Can be busy at times and the staff is overburdened at such times.

data.title: This Panera makes the dough, but not the grade.
data.text:
I'm near a lover. So it pains me to say that this location just doesn't cut it.  I was staying at the terrific came Brea hotel across the street, so Panera was very convenient during lunch hour. 

 Many times, I was in and out in 15 to 20 minutes. 

 Unfortunately, the sandwich crew process seems very inefficient. So the order was taken promptly and with a smile but most diners waited around for their take-out for 15 to 20 minutes. Really not acceptable.  In that long wait gives you a chance to hear all the grumbling and complains that the staff has about their patrons. Very unprofessional team.  that's why I say, this particular  Panera makes the dough, but not the grade.
Stick to their core the sellers like the asiago roast beef sandwich and soup but run away quickly from the new Asian soup offerings which are salty and really prepared to spec.
 Don't get me wrong, I still love Panera but this location needs an overhaul and retraining.

data.title: Try the Pumpkin muffins, you will not be disappointed!
data.text: We were staying across the road and decided to have muffins for breakfast most mornings, especially after trying the pumpkin ones. Yum, yum.

data.title: What happened to the Turkey on Country?
data.text: I used to enjoy and occasional Turkey on Country bread sandwich at Panera.  When I went recently, it was awful.  The Turkey seemed it was turkey roll, 3 slices stuck together - I thought there used to be some kind of dressing on it - there was none.  I went there because I was expecting something and was disappointed it had changed - for the worse.
